pact.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a formal agreement between two groups, countries, or people, especially to help each other or to stop fighting
pact.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The two countries signed a non-aggression pact.
a defence pact with the USA
a peace pact between the rebels and the government
pact.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a formal agreement between two countries, companies, groups of people etc, promising to do something for each other or help each other in some way
pact.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Workers at the factory ratified a three-year pact (=made it official) that boosts their pay.
The National Institute of Health signed a pact with a Japanese drug company to develop and test a new anti-AIDS drug.
Mexico is in its fourth month of negotiations on a free-trade pact with the US and Canada.
